title: Blockchain
summary: Blockchain is a distributed ledger technology maintaining a continuously growing list of cryptographically secured records called blocks. Originating from Satoshi Nakamoto's 2008 Bitcoin whitepaper, it enables secure transactions without trusted third parties by using consensus mechanisms like proof-of-work. Beyond cryptocurrencies, blockchain supports applications in supply chain, health records, and smart contracts, offering transparency, immutability, and decentralization.

factual.claim: Bitcoin's network processes ~7 transactions per second
Global cryptocurrency market cap is ~$3.8 trillion

interpretive.statement: Blockchain offers transparency, immutability, and decentralization
Technology enables secure transactions without trusted third parties
Critically optimistic about blockchain's potential with awareness of trade-offs
